text: hi everyone
Anthony Fantino here the Internet's
busiest music nerd and it's time for you
review of the new Tsar face LP czar face
is a new collaborative project including
hip hop veterans such as inspected deck
of the wu-tang clan and 7l and esoteric
and this LP and in this collaboration
has gathered quite a bit of attention in
the hip hop world at the start of this
year although I'm not completely sure as
to why that has been I mean I have
enjoyed quite a bit of work from 7l and
esoteric as well as inspected deck when
they are involved in other projects such
as the wu-tang clan and I think esoteric
has made many many fantastic
contributions to albums from groups such
as the demigods as well as Jedi Mind
Tricks these guys have always showcased
a certain amount of energy and a certain
amount of precision when it comes to
being a part of a group being a part of
a larger collective but when it comes to
their solo stuff it just hasn't
withstood the test of time in the way
that the music that influences these
guys has or at least an Inspector Dex
case the music made by his other cohorts
in the wu-tang clan his production
hasn't really been that sharp lately and
his latest full-length LP manifesto
which came out in 2010 was easily as
most lackluster yet and as far as 7l and
esoteric go they have quite a few
records under their belt - even though
esoteric does have a voice that has
presence and 7l puts together beats that
do bring together those oldschool
boom-bap grooves
it's just nor near as fiery or as gritty
as the New York hip hop records that
they worshiped 7ln esoterics last
full-length LP actually dropped the same
year that inspected Dex last full-length
LP did and both of them were relatively
swept under the rug when it comes to
East Coast hip-hop so I just don't see
the reason to freak out just because
they're collaborating and they have an
album cover that looks like a comic book
and they had this new name this new
pseudonym and there's like an axe
figure that's now in production because
of this collaboration however this
collaboration could be a cause for alarm
because certainly 7l and esoteric and
Inspectah deck have proven that they
work better in a collaboration in a
group in a collective and certainly as
our face is that and actually that's
that's kind of the case on this thing so
our face is for the most part not really
that bad of collaboration across the
fourteen tracks on here I don't really
think they put out a terrible song
however even though 7l esoteric and
inspect a deck do meld together well as
a trio I don't really think they have
sharpened their skills or their styles
in any significant way on this new
collaboration I just feel like they
prevent one another from making terrible
music because it's certainly not like
the fire of the 90s gets sparked once
again on this new collab because there
are times on this new LP where the
tracks do kind of feel like this
exercise of boom bap hip hop not really
this energetic blood pumping recreation
of it which artists like progressive era
are so easily able to drum up for some
strange reason even though they didn't
even grow up in that time of hip-hop
stills our face is a pretty well crafted
album it's just that sometimes it feels
a little too reserved to be exciting and
that's all the production on this LP
overall is pretty sharp 7l pulls some
really good grooves and drum breaks
together especially on one of the
opening tracks on this thing Arum out
this drum break is gonna crack some
freaking heads the murky bass line is
really cool too in the air I'm out Aaron
a vocal chance over the hook are pretty
catchy as well while it can't kind of
bug me at times that it's very apparent
that I&S is not really that emcee that
he used to be he's not really that dude
that's going hard he doesn't really have
that gruff voice that he used to have
when he said I Messiah I set the
microphone on fire
he feels way more laid-back way more
subtle and kind of understated at times
on this LP in comparison with his older
stuff however I feel like he puts a lot
of the personal history that he has had
in hip hop
music into his lyrics he really peppers
it throughout his lyrics in some pretty
subtle ways that results in some really
good wordplay at times however it's not
like his flow comes off as detailed or
as crazy on this track Arum out as
esoterics does as soon as he flies in
not only does his voice sound way louder
because he's just trying to frickin body
this bee but it feels like there's an
extra helping of vocal effects maybe
it's a chorus or something like that to
make his voice stand out I'm just sort
of wondering why inspect a dect and
really get the same treatment maybe it
was just some kind of personal
preference or something like that but
when inspected deck comes out to rap his
voice feels way lower and way quieter in
comparison to esoterics which really
just comes out and grabs the listener by
the throat on the same track esoterics
flow is changing up one set of bars
after another his random violent lyrical
musings remind me a lot of the
old-school routing sound which he is
very clearly influenced by and comes off
pretty sharp for the most part and his
references are pretty nutty as well
talking about people like - no at the
end of a line he sounds way hungrier in
comparison to inspect a deck and you
know while I understand at this point
inspected deck doesn't really have
anything to prove to the hip-hop world
because of everything he's given to it
already up until this point it still
doesn't make this a thrilling
collaboration to listen to at times
because of the the variations of energy
between these two MCS I just kind of
wish that inspector deck and esoteric
had a middle point that they both kind
of reached on this collaboration because
at times esoteric is really sort of one
freaking note when it comes to his
aggression and his hard-ass voice still
to continue with the production the
weeping violin on the track cement three
is really awesome the groove on that
beat is solid as well
it feels like a little bit of Rizal
worship and there's a very obvious old
dirty bastard sample on this track as
well it could have been a little bit
more surprising creative other than what
they actually ended up doing with this
hook the songs are Raphael he also has a
weak hook as well which is just like
this echoed vocal cut of za face face
face face face face me it just feels so
kind of mucky and not well placed
against the beat which I actually do
like a lot it feels sort of MF DOOM ish
with all these samples coming from what
feels like some kind of superhero
soundtrack with of course the music that
would play when the villain enters the
scene all these villainous strings and
horns and orchestrations it's very dark
it's very dramatic and the song rock
beast has this awesome awesome organ
sample leading the way not exactly novel
or imaginative or adventurous or
anything like that but it gets a groove
going gets the blood pumping another
moment on this LP that actually kind of
reminds me of MF DOOM is the song
savagely attack which grabs this drum
break and guitar sample that many of you
may already remember famously from the
mad villain instrumental cut sick fit
except it's played at a higher speed on
this particular track and another thing
that kind of reminds me of MF to mull
over this LP is just the villainous
character that is our face tries to put
together if I feel like Ghostface Killah
and MF DOOM have already done this but
they take these vocal snippets they take
these sounds and they actually try to
develop a character around them as our
face I don't really think does that
instead they sort of play out all of
these vocal narrations without actually
putting in the work to drum up this dark
villainous character and build a
storyline build the concept it's just
sort of this loose blueprint of the
concept that was hammered out by other
people and it's just sort of being
xeroxed on here but to kind of continue
on this track savagely attack Inspectah
deck does have lyrics on this song like
the one line where he drops this
basic-cable reference to live from the
ER where the talk of the town without
the pr i mean some witty stuff but once
fils Killa comes in later on this track
a lot like he says in the very lyrics of
his verse he is absolutely ruthless not
only with his lyrics saying that he's
like this dude who comes in violently
like he's on bath salts but he sounds
way hungrier even hungrier and more
aggressive than esoteric himself and
he's got personality in being aggressive
and being cut throat he actually sounds
hungrier than much of anybody else on
this entire album I think the only emcee
that potentially steps to him when it
comes to attention-grabbing energy on
this thing is the verse that oh no drop
time the song world war four kind of has
this old-school fast-paced exploitation
film soundtrack funk sample to it with
this food kind of dancing on top of the
bead that I like a lot however this
track drives inspected deck and so2 spit
at a much faster pace he doesn't really
come off as intelligible as Esso when
he's just trying to flow at this speed
however I feel like this help he picks
up a little bit more with the song
poisonous thoughts which has one of the
best beats I feel on this album and is a
little bit more of RZA worship just a
little guitar lead calling out in this
cavernous way i NS and esoteric not only
sound great on this spacious beat but
there is a beat switch up later in the
song that introduces mr. [ __ ] ex
choir who actually has a pretty
eccentric and and fun [ __ ] talking verse
that I liked a lot however not every
emcee on this LP kind of gets the red
carpet rolled out for them like mr.
[ __ ] X choir did actually the
issue for me is that many other MCS on
this LP sound mix badly kind of drowned
out sort of muddy with their vocals or
maybe not even that enthusiastic with
their verse when they come through
especially Action Bronson as well as
Cappadonna
overall the production on this LP is
pretty good the lyrics are pretty good
the flows occasionally can be shaky and
there's really not enough variety or
original inspiration on this entire
thing to make it feel as fresh as as
some people are making it out to
be unfortunately this album really does
kind of bite off a little bit more than
it can chew by throwing out all these
vocal snippets and all these narrations
which at the end of the day just come
off as a gimmick because they don't
really develop it into anything other
than just sort of a distraction or a
bumper between tracks feeling a decent
two strong six on this LP if you've
given it a listen
what did you think about it did you love
it did you hate it why what do you think
I should review next and yeah that's
about it
7l esoteric inspected Dec czar faced
forever
